action.action-desc: Mr. Vasquez (for himself and Mr. Mann) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to establish a program to provide assistance to underserved airports to improve passenger and flight capacity, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expanding Regional Airports Act.

subsection.text: Chapter 417 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
The Secretary of Transportation shall establish a program to provide grants to eligible airports to improve passenger and flight capacity.
An eligible airport may use a grant provided under this section for—

paragraph.text: activities that improve passenger and flight capacity at such airport, including—

subparagraph.text: the expansion of passenger and property screening facilities;

paragraph.text: costs incurred to comply with operational and security requirements under part 139 or part 154 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.

subsection.text: In carrying out the program established under this section, the Secretary shall provide not less than 3 and not more than 10 grants to eligible airports in each fiscal year.
In this section, the term eligible airport means an airport that—

paragraph.text: is a general aviation airport or a nonprimary commercial service airport (as determined by the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration); and
serves a community with a population of at least 75,000.

section.text: There is authorized to be appropriated for each fiscal year $50,000,000 to carry out section 41781.
